department.dept_long_name: Committee on the Study of Religion

course.title: New Directions in Hindu Studies
course.description: What does it mean to study South Asian religions in a postcolonial context, in the wake of scathing critique, in light of the work of Said, Chakrabarthy, Inden, Pollock, and others? Through careful examination of recent works in the field, this seminar explores the current state of Hindu Studies and assesses possible directions for future work.
course.prerequisites: Previous study of South Asian religions.
course.notes: Offered jointly with the Divinity school as 3924.
